fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: Low-power mode selection These bits select the low-power mode entered when CPU enters the deepsleep mode. 1xx: Shutdown mode Note: If LPR bit is set, Stop 2 mode cannot be selected and Stop 1 mode shall be entered instead of Stop 2. Note: In Standby mode, SRAM2 can be preserved or not, depending on RRS bit configuration in PWR_CR3.

fields.name: FPD_STOP
fields.description: Flash memory powered down during Stop mode. This bit determines whether the flash memory is put in power-down mode or remains in idle mode when the device enters Stop mode.

fields.name: FPD_LPRUN
fields.description: Flash memory powered down during Low-power run mode. This bit determines whether the flash memory is put in power-down mode or remains in idle mode when the device enters Low-power sleep mode.

fields.name: FPD_LPSLP
fields.description: Flash memory powered down during Low-power sleep mode. This bit determines whether the flash memory is put in power-down mode or remains in idle mode when the device enters Low-power sleep mode.

fields.name: DBP
fields.description: Disable backup domain write protection In reset state, the RTC and backup registers are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable write access to these registers.

fields.name: VOS
fields.description: Voltage scaling range selection

fields.name: LPR
fields.description: Low-power run When this bit is set, the regulator is switched from main mode (MR) to low-power mode (LPR). Note: Stop 2 mode cannot be entered when LPR bit is set. Stop 1 is entered instead.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector enable Note: This bit is write-protected when the bit PVDL (PVD Lock) is set in the SYSCFG_CBR register. Note: This bit is reset only by a system reset.

fields.name: PLS
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector level selection. These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the programmable voltage detector: Note: These bits are write-protected when the bit PVDL (PVD Lock) is set in the SYSCFG_CBR register. Note: These bits are reset only by a system reset.

fields.name: PVME1
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring 1 enable: V<sub>DDUSB</sub> vs. 1.21V

fields.name: PVME3
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring 3 enable: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 1.621V

fields.name: PVME4
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring 4 enable: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 1.861V

fields.name: USV
fields.description: V<sub>DDUSB</sub> USB supply valid This bit is used to validate the V<sub>DDUSB</sub> supply for electrical and logical isolation purpose. Setting this bit is mandatory to use the USB FS peripheral. If V<sub>DDUSB</sub> is not always present in the application, the PVM can be used to determine whether this supply is ready or not.

fields.name: EWUP1
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP1 When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP1 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP1 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: EWUP2
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP2 When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP2 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP2 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: EWUP3
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP3 When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP3 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP3 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: EWUP4
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP4 When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP4 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs. The active edge is configured via the WP4 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: EWUP5
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP5 When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP5 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs.The active edge is configured via the WP5 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: EWUP7
fields.description: Enable Wake-up pin WKUP7. When this bit is set, the external wake-up pin WKUP7 is enabled and triggers a wake-up from Standby or Shutdown event when a rising or a falling edge occurs.The active edge is configured via the WP7 bit in the PWR_CR4 register.

fields.name: RRS
fields.description: SRAM2 retention in Standby mode

fields.name: ENULP
fields.description: Enable ULP sampling When this bit is set, the BORL, BORH and PVD are periodically sampled instead continuous monitoring to reduce power consumption. Fast supply drop between two sample/compare phases is not detected in this mode. This bit has impact only on STOP2, Standby and shutdown low power modes.

fields.name: APC
fields.description: Apply pull-up and pull-down configuration When this bit is set, the I/O pull-up and pull-down configurations defined in the PWR_PUCRx and PWR_PDCRx registers are applied. When this bit is cleared, the PWR_PUCRx and PWR_PDCRx registers are not applied to the I/Os, instead the I/Os are in floating mode during Standby or configured according GPIO controller GPIOx_PUPDR register during RUN mode.

fields.name: EIWUL
fields.description: Enable internal wake-up line

fields.name: WP1
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP1 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP1

fields.name: WP2
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP2 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP2

fields.name: WP3
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP3 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP3

fields.name: WP4
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP4 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP4

fields.name: WP5
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP5 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP5

fields.name: WP7
fields.description: Wake-up pin WKUP7 polarity This bit defines the polarity used for an event detection on external wake-up pin, WKUP7

fields.name: VBE
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> battery charging enable

fields.name: VBRS
fields.description: V<sub>BAT</sub> battery charging resistor selection

fieldset/PUCRA.description: Power Port A pull-up control register

fields.name: PU0
fields.description: Port A pull-up bit y (y1=115 to 0) When set, this bit activates the pull-up on PA[y] when APC bit is set in PWR_CR3 register. If the corresponding PDy bit is also set, the pull-up is not activated and the pull-down is activated instead with highest priority.

fields.name: PU1
fields.description: Port A pull-up bit y (y1=115 to 0) When set, this bit activates the pull-up on PA[y] when APC bit is set in PWR_CR3 register. If the corresponding PDy bit is also set, the pull-up is not activated and the pull-down is activated instead with highest priority.

fields.name: CWUF1
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 1 Setting this bit clears the WUF1 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CWUF2
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 2 Setting this bit clears the WUF2 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CWUF3
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 3 Setting this bit clears the WUF3 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CWUF4
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 4 Setting this bit clears the WUF4 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CWUF5
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 5 Setting this bit clears the WUF5 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CWUF7
fields.description: Clear wake-up flag 7 Setting this bit clears the WUF7 flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: CSBF
fields.description: Clear standby flag Setting this bit clears the SBF flag in the PWR_SR1 register.

fields.name: WUF1
fields.description: Wake-up flag 1 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin, WKUP1. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF1 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: WUF2
fields.description: Wake-up flag 2 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin, WKUP2. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF2 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: WUF3
fields.description: Wake-up flag 3 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin, WKUP3. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF3 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: WUF4
fields.description: Wake-up flag 4 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin,WKUP4. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF4 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: WUF5
fields.description: Wake-up flag 5 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin, WKUP5. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF5 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: WUF7
fields.description: Wake-up flag 7 This bit is set when a wake-up event is detected on wake-up pin, WKUP7. It is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF7 bit of the PWR_SCR register.

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters the Standby mode and is cleared by setting the CSBF bit in the PWR_SCR register, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Stop Flags These bits are set by hardware when the device enters any stop mode and are cleared by setting the CSBF bit in the PWR_SCR register, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

fields.name: WUFI
fields.description: Wake-up flag internal This bit is set when a wake-up is detected on the internal wake-up line. It is cleared when all internal wake-up sources are cleared.

fields.name: FLASH_RDY
fields.description: Flash ready flag This bit is set by hardware to indicate when the flash memory is readey to be accessed after wake-up from power-down. To place the flash memory in power-down, set either FPD_LPRUN, FPD_LPSLP or FPD_STP bits. Note : If the system boots from SRAM, the user application must wait until the FLASH_RDY bit is set, prior to jumping to flash memory.

fields.name: REGLPS
fields.description: Low-power regulator started This bit provides the information whether the low-power regulator is ready after a power-on reset or a Standby/Shutdown. If the Standby mode is entered while REGLPS bit is still cleared, the wake-up from Standby mode time may be increased.

fields.name: REGLPF
fields.description: Low-power regulator flag This bit is set by hardware when the MCU is in Low-power run mode. When the MCU exits from the Low-power run mode, this bit remains at 1 until the regulator is ready in main mode. A polling on this bit must be done before increasing the product frequency. This bit is cleared by hardware when the regulator is ready.

fields.name: VOSF
fields.description: Voltage scaling flag A delay is required for the internal regulator to be ready after the voltage scaling has been changed. VOSF indicates that the regulator reached the voltage level defined with VOS bits of the PWR_CR1 register.

fields.name: PVDO
fields.description: Programmable voltage detector output

fields.name: PVMO1
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring output: V<sub>DDUSB</sub> vs. 1.2 V Note: PVMO1 is cleared when PVM1 is disabled (PVME1 = 0). After enabling PVM1, the PVM1 output is valid after the PVM1 wake-up time.

fields.name: PVMO3
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring output: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 1.621V Note: PVMO3 is cleared when PVM3 is disabled (PVME3 = 0). After enabling PVM3, the PVM3 output is valid after the PVM3 wake-up time.

fields.name: PVMO4
fields.description: Peripheral voltage monitoring output: V<sub>DDA</sub> vs. 2.21V Note: PVMO4 is cleared when PVM4 is disabled (PVME4 = 0). After enabling PVM4, the PVM4 output is valid after the PVM4 wake-up time.

variants.name: B_0x7
variants.description: External input analog voltage PVD_IN (compared internally to VREFINT)

variants.name: None
variants.description: The device did not enter any Stop mode.

variants.name: Stop0
variants.description: The device entered in Stop 0 mode.

variants.name: Stop1
variants.description: The device entered in Stop 1 mode.

variants.name: Stop2
variants.description: The device entered in Stop 2 mode.
